about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system?

about.name: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system?

hasPart.assesses: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system? | Which child would require a child passenger restraint system? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Children who are eight years old or older, or who have reached at least 4 feet 9 inches in height, may use a properly secured safety belt meeting federal standards. Other children must be seated in a child passenger restraint system.

suggestedAnswer.text: A 9-year-old who is 4 feet 10 inches tall

comment.text: A 9-year-old who is 4 feet 10 inches tall

suggestedAnswer.text: A 10-year-old who is 5 feet 3 inches tall

comment.text: A 10-year-old who is 5 feet 3 inches tall

suggestedAnswer.text: A 7-year-old who is 4 feet 8 inches tall

comment.text: A 7-year-old who is 4 feet 8 inches tall

acceptedAnswer.text: A 7-year-old who is 4 feet 8 inches tall

comment.text: A 7-year-old who is 4 feet 8 inches tall

answerExplanation.text: Children who are eight years old or older, or who have reached at least 4 feet 9 inches in height, may use a properly secured safety belt meeting federal standards. Other children must be seated in a child passenger restraint system.

comment.text: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system? | Children who are eight years old or older, or who have reached at least 4 feet 9 inches in height, may use a properly secured safety belt meeting federal standards. Other children must be seated in a child passenger restraint system.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system?

hasPart.name: When you tailgate other drivers (drive closely to their rear bumper):

about.name: When you tailgate other drivers (drive closely to their rear bumper):

hasPart.assesses: When you tailgate other drivers (drive closely to their rear bumper): | When you tailgate other drivers (drive closely to their rear bumper): -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

suggestedAnswer.text: You can frustrate the other drivers and make them angry.

comment.text: You can frustrate the other drivers and make them angry.

suggestedAnswer.text: Your actions cannot result in a traffic citation.

comment.text: Your actions cannot result in a traffic citation.
You help reduce traffic congestion.

acceptedAnswer.text: You can frustrate the other drivers and make them angry.

comment.text: You can frustrate the other drivers and make them angry.

answerExplanation.text: Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

comment.text: When you tailgate other drivers (drive closely to their rear bumper): | Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

hasPart.name: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should:

about.name: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should: | If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers should not use a cell phone without a hands-free device. For minors, it is illegal to use any cell phone while driving, except in an emergency. Even if you do have a hands-free device, it is recommended that you let calls go to voicemail while driving in order to avoid distractions.

suggestedAnswer.text: Answer the call because it may be an emergency.

comment.text: Answer the call because it may be an emergency.

suggestedAnswer.text: Let the call go to voicemail.

comment.text: Let the call go to voicemail.

suggestedAnswer.text: Check the incoming number before answering the call.

comment.text: Check the incoming number before answering the call.

acceptedAnswer.text: Let the call go to voicemail.

comment.text: Let the call go to voicemail.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers should not use a cell phone without a hands-free device. For minors, it is illegal to use any cell phone while driving, except in an emergency. Even if you do have a hands-free device, it is recommended that you let calls go to voicemail while driving in order to avoid distractions.

comment.text: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should: | Drivers should not use a cell phone without a hands-free device. For minors, it is illegal to use any cell phone while driving, except in an emergency. Even if you do have a hands-free device, it is recommended that you let calls go to voicemail while driving in order to avoid distractions.

hasPart.name: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic?

about.name: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic?

hasPart.assesses: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic? | Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited.

suggestedAnswer.text: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.

comment.text: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique.

comment.text: Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yes, it is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

comment.text: Yes, it is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.

comment.text: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.

answerExplanation.text: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited.

comment.text: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic? | You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited.

educationalAlignment.targetName: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic?

hasPart.name: If you must park your vehicle in an area not usually used for parking:

about.name: If you must park your vehicle in an area not usually used for parking:

hasPart.assesses: If you must park your vehicle in an area not usually used for parking: | If you must park your vehicle in an area not usually used for parking: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers are responsible for making sure their vehicles do not become hazards after they have been parked. Wherever you park, make sure your car is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.

suggestedAnswer.text: Park with your reverse lights on.

comment.text: Park with your reverse lights on.

suggestedAnswer.text: Make sure your vehicle is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.

comment.text: Make sure your vehicle is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.

suggestedAnswer.text: Park five feet from the curb.

comment.text: Park five feet from the curb.

acceptedAnswer.text: Make sure your vehicle is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.

comment.text: Make sure your vehicle is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers are responsible for making sure their vehicles do not become hazards after they have been parked. Wherever you park, make sure your car is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.

comment.text: If you must park your vehicle in an area not usually used for parking: | Drivers are responsible for making sure their vehicles do not become hazards after they have been parked. Wherever you park, make sure your car is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.

hasPart.name: This sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This sign means: | This sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Orange, diamond-shaped signs are used to mark construction, maintenance, survey, and utility work areas. These signs help direct drivers and pedestrians safely through dangerous zones. Fines for traffic convictions may double in areas marked by these signs.

comment.text: Do not enter.
Stop ahead.
Roadwork or maintenance is present.
Roadwork or maintenance is present.

answerExplanation.text: Orange, diamond-shaped signs are used to mark construction, maintenance, survey, and utility work areas. These signs help direct drivers and pedestrians safely through dangerous zones. Fines for traffic convictions may double in areas marked by these signs.

comment.text: This sign means: | Orange, diamond-shaped signs are used to mark construction, maintenance, survey, and utility work areas. These signs help direct drivers and pedestrians safely through dangerous zones. Fines for traffic convictions may double in areas marked by these signs.
